DefaultEvent.Description: What was missing is now restored, with no harm done save a sudden itching and an urge to swing from the trees by the tail you realise you no longer have. Both will hopefully fade in due course.
DefaultEvent.Name: A sense of wholeness

ChildBranches.Name: A flatulent ape
ChildBranches.Description: Goodness, the stench! The other monkeys howl with amusement, even as they pull as far away as possible.

DefaultEvent.Description: What was missing is now restored, with no harm done save a sudden itching and an urge to swing from the trees by the tail you realise you no longer have. Both will hopefully fade in due course.
DefaultEvent.Name: A sense of wholeness

ChildBranches.Name: A jabbering ape
ChildBranches.Description: Squawk, squawk - that's all it does, spittle and the occasional recognisable word flying with equal worth.

DefaultEvent.Description: What was missing is now restored, with no harm done save a sudden itching and an urge to swing from the trees by the tail you realise you no longer have. Both will hopefully fade in due course.
DefaultEvent.Name: A sense of wholeness

ChildBranches.Name: An intoxicated ape
ChildBranches.Description: It gropes a stolen bottle of mushroom wine, hiccuping and burping as it relieves itself from a branch.

DefaultEvent.Description: What was missing is now restored, with no harm done save a sudden itching and an urge to swing from the trees by the tail you realise you no longer have. Both will hopefully fade in due course.
DefaultEvent.Name: A sense of wholeness

ChildBranches.Name: A filthy ape
ChildBranches.Description: Its matted hair and rotting teeth are a testament to bad health and worse self-respect.

DefaultEvent.Description: Is not eleven per cent of Fallen London now getting along just fine without one? Though should anyone ask, it was a devil that bought it. Definitely a devil.
DefaultEvent.Name: Who needs a soul anyway?

ChildBranches.Name: None of them
ChildBranches.Description: The mere thought that you would see yourself in one of these miserable, pathetic beasts!

Description: Which monkey took it? Is there anything about one of these that seems strangely familiar?
Name: Recover your soul
